question:
Identify the tiger reserve of India with the help of given information:
  1. It is located in the strategic confluence region of Western and Eastern Ghats.
  2. Out of the 700 species of flora found in this forest, more than 60 are considered endemic.
  3. The forest is also home to wild mugger crocodile population and vulture population
  4. It was declared a tiger reserve in 2013
Select the correct answer from option given below:
explanation: All given features are of Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve Sathyamangalam Forest in Erode district has been declared a Tiger Reserve. It is the fourth tiger reserve in Tamil Nadu. The other three tiger reserves in the state are at Mudumalai in the Nilgiris district, Anamalai in Coimbatore district and Kalakad-Mundanthurai in Tirunelveli district. Sathyamangalam is home to at least 25 tigers, which has been confirmed by various studies conducted by our department and the World Wildlife Fund. The forest is also home to wild mugger, vultures, elephants, tigers, black bucks & hyenas. The elephant population in the region is estimated to be around 1,200.
